biotools.summary: LDWeaver accepts a sequence alignment (fasta) and its reference annotation (genbank or gff) as inputs and identifies linkage disequilibrium (LD) between pairs of variants (links) that is unusually high given the genomic distance between the pair. This high LD could be the result of co-selection or epistasis. Approximate statistical significance is used to rank outlier links and the output is reported in tsv format, along with several other helpful annotations and figures. Additionally, LDWeaver has functions to assist the detection of genomic regions that have potentially undergone co-selection or epistasis.
